wikipedia_page.main: Sir Philip Hubert Martineau (28 October 1862 – 7 October 1944) was an English solicitor who became President of the Law Society. He was also a cricketer who played for Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) as a left-arm fast-medium bowler.

response: * Sir Philip Martineau (1862–1944), English cricketer and lawyer

Born in Westminster in 1891, the son of Philip Martineau,Philip Martineau  at CricketArchive Hubert Martineau was educated at Eton, though he did not play for the school's cricket team. He did however develop a great love of the game.

Alfred Martineau was educated at Uppingham School and King's College, Cambridge. A right-handed batsman and right-arm slow bowler, he played two first-class matches for Cambridge University in 1889.CricketArchive profile His brother Lionel also played first-class cricket,Lionel Martineau at CricketArchive as did his cousins HubertHubert Martineau at CricketArchive and Philip.Philip Martineau at CricketArchive

After graduating from Cambridge, Martineau became a solicitor and was a partner at Martineau and Reid, based in London at Gray's Inn. Besides playing cricket, he was a tennis and hockey player and was the first president of Esher Tennis Club, with the tennis club based on the Littleworth Estate, which was owned by the Martineau family.Sporting Notices. Clifton Society. 29 November 1906. p. 16 Martineau died at Esher in November 1906.Mr. L. Martineau. Cricket. 29 November 1906. p. 18 His brother, Alfred, played first-class cricket, as did his cousins Hubert and Philip Martineau.
